alert.note: Alert for Bladen; Coastal Brunswick; Columbus; Inland Brunswick; Inland Pender (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 3:59PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Pender, southeastern Bladen, Brunswick and eastern Columbus Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 358 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Penderlea to Pireway. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Burgaw, Shallotte, Sunset Beach, Holden Beach, Ocean Isle Beach, Iredell, Rowan, Lake Waccamaw, Northwest, Sandyfield, Penderlea, Makatoka, Point Caswell, Long Creek, Exum, Longwood, Seaside, Currie, Carvers and Honey Island. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 388 and 403. US Route 17 in Brunswick County between mile markers 2 and 28. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southeastern North Carolina.

area.areaDesc: Bladen; Coastal Brunswick; Columbus; Inland Brunswick; Inland Pender
